A spin-dependent tunnelling constant \cite{flensberg_spin} is used, $\lambda_{\uparrow} = \lambda$ and $\lambda_{\downarrow} = -i\lambda$, due to the fact that the MBS spin is polarized along $\pm\hat{y}$ while the dot spin is along $\pm\hat{x}$. The MBS splitting $\epsilon$ is proportional the overlap of the MBS wavefunctions \cite{kitaev, splitting_smoking_gun_12}, which are localized at the edges of the topological region.
